website_summaries.verdict: The best value in terms of its reliability and intense lights that effortlessly brighten up expansive outdoor settings.
pros: Stands out for its bright LED lights and prolonged run time on high power
cons: Inaccurate charging instructions leave many users confused and frustrated

customer_reviews.title: Very good light.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I bought the first about 3 years ago and the battery quit charging. After I bought the new one I took the old one apart and wished I would have replaced the SLA battery in it. It has a battery with push on connectors and if you look around you can get one online for half the price of a new light. This is a very bright light and runs for about 6 hrs on a full charge on high setting.
customer_reviews.author: Made in USA

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and recieved it broken, it wont charge! Tried to contact seller but there is no way, only thing you can find is "WE DONT ACCEPT RETURNS" IF I HAD KNOWN THAT UP FRONT, I WOULD NOT HAVE BOUGHT!!!!!! Buy at your own risk! if it does not work on arrival you are stuck with a 40 dollar flashlight. the only other thing they say is contact manufacturer, but they said that they have no control over what is bought on amazon, so your stuck like chuck, AVOID
customer_reviews.author: plwiseman

customer_reviews.title: Bright, sturdy, light weight.
customer_reviews.text: This is significantly brighter than you would expect. We can see over a long distance and into the woods. The light is bright and clear and compared to other lights we had with the same lumens, this is definitely half the weight. It is very light, sturdy and quick to recharge. There is a low beam and a high beam and both work well. I like them because we have a large wooded area behind our house and there are many animals from deer to bear and foxes. I like being able to see them before I leave my deck. I am going to buy a second light so that we always have a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Beware of battery life
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third and last Cyclops. Charging is very erratic, sometimes I have to leave it plugged in to use it. Very inconvenient and irritating. Most of these don't last a year.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoors Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Good spotlight until it quit charging.
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 of these spotlights, ordered from Amazon over several years. The older ones work great and are still working great. 4 plus years. The newest one, 6 months, will not take a charge. I've ordered new batteries for the ones (2) that aren't holding a charge or will not charge. We'll see if this helps. I'm looking into other spotlights as I use them every night to check things around the ranch. These newer spotlights should have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Useless with the red lens
customer_reviews.text: If you are getting this to use with the red lens, forget it. Once you put it on the light is useless because it is so dark. I have a $30 red led flashlight that puts this thing to shame. This will just sit in a drawer now because it is useless since it does not work as expected and I cannot return it.
customer_reviews.author: TBSS

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cyclops Sirius 500 Spotlight purchased recently to replace the first one that I bought nearly 4 years ago. Something internal finally malfunctioned on the first one. Could be a loose wire, trigger switch, probably fixable. But in reality, I knew I wanted an exact replica of the original and that is what I got. Lightweight, comfortable grip and durable, this light proved to be a winner. Left out in the rain, extreme heat, freezing temperatures, dropped countless times and kept on going. There is a updated version of this spotlight. Not sure what the update is, other than a reverse image of the original. I highly recommend this one. Cyclops HAND HELD RECHARGEABLE LIGHTS CYC-X500H Flashlight
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look for other options
customer_reviews.text: We have owned two of these now. The light is good, but over time they break down and don't charge right. We discovered Olight brand and use one of their products now. It is so compact and so much easier to charge. We use at night to check the yard before we go out into the countryside or let the animals out.
customer_reviews.author: LV

customer_reviews.title: Holy Cow Batman!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the 300 lumen Cyclops spot light. Had it for years, but my son had dropped it twice, and the second time it started to have issues with longevity. So I went out to get a new one and HOLY COW, this is much better. Will light up my entire back yard. Does not last as long as the 300 lumen, but I don't need it more than 20 min at a time.
customer_reviews.author: KC of Indy

customer_reviews.title: The light was great for when I used it
customer_reviews.text: The light was great for when I used it, but now I've been trying to charge it for the past week hoping it would charge, and it's not. From the reviews it doesn't look like you can return it and I'm not sure who to contact to see if a complimentary replacement is available or not.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Best handheld spotlight made
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 of these for myself and four to be given as gifts. We have taped these to the front of snowmobiles for riding at night, hunted pigs in Texas with them, illuminated our pasture when foxes are screaming so we can see them, the list is endless. I always drain completely before charging. I'll turn it to spot light, hide in cupboard overnight and most mornings, it still has enough light left to walk around a dark house for an hour! Best handheld spotlight, hands down!
customer_reviews.author: jim yates

customer_reviews.title: Junk from China
customer_reviews.text: Unit was defective right out of the box. Light that shows charge status does not work and you cannot tell if it is charged. Overall poor quality. I am afraid it might overcharge and start on fire. What a shame as I had one just like it for years before it stopped working. Look elsewhere as this is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mississippiguy

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: I use this for skunk patrol. My back yard is large and the skunks dig under the fence. Summer morinings, I have to keep the dogs in the house until I can sweep the yard for stinkers, and this flashlight does a great job. Very bright, love the trigger on/off switch and it's got a terrific reach. Easy to charge.
customer_reviews.author: maryfrances

customer_reviews.title: Find a more reliable product.
customer_reviews.text: I saw numerous reviews complaining about the light not taking a charge, but I figured those things happen occasionally. Well, it happened to me too. Right out of the box, the light would not take a charge. This product is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY SUCKS !!
customer_reviews.text: I own 8 of these lights. The battery last about a year, average, and begins to deteriorate rapidly. I could say more, but that is the main feature of these lights.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Smith

customer_reviews.title: Defective, dangerous item with no return
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in and the charger began to smell and melt after about 10 minutes. If we had left home, our home would have caught fire. Plus there is no return policy for defective items or anyone who will contact me regarding my issue.
customer_reviews.author: JoLynne Slivyak

customer_reviews.title: Be Cautious - stopped charging within first year...
customer_reviews.text: Nice a Bright when charged. We have (should say had) three - two of the three won’t charge any longer.....the charger receptacle on light stopped working/will no longer work with the charger unit - like the connection in the light works loose. Wouldn’t think anything of it, but it’s happened twice now (with two different units)...so now will be purchasing another brand. I paid almost $50 per light at the time of purchase - $100 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila M.

customer_reviews.title: Great light
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet hand held light. Very very bright which allows me to see around my large property. It holds a charge a long time yet it's very light weight imo. It's also extremely well made and hopefully will last a long time. Charges up nicely and has a good system to indicate it's state of charge. Be sure and bring it to full charge even though it will work when it arrives! For the money one of the better hand held LED lights out there. Unless you require spotting airplanes this should get the job done imo.........
customer_reviews.author: cthusker

customer_reviews.title: Lights up the night
customer_reviews.text: Love this spotlight. It's not as heavy or as bulky as the previous one we had. Living out in the woods, you gotta have a spotlight. It has to give light for more than 3 minutes at a time. It has to hold a charge. This one has been great so far. Nice and bright, clear light, not yellowish. Love the gun grip handle, it's easier to hold than the typical rectangular or rounded type.
customer_reviews.author: AuntieRoo

customer_reviews.title: Dagon good light
customer_reviews.text: This is our go-to rechargeable flashlight. It's not too heavy, holds a charge for a long time, has a couple of different settings, and is tough and shockproof. The only problem I have is that someone else is using it when I need it. I'm just going to have to buy another just like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Caster

customer_reviews.title: Great for checking on the cows
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as our other 2 spotlights were duds and I threw them out. This one is pricey but had good reviews so we tried it, and he LOVES it. Says he can see clear across the pen of 120 cows ready to calve and not have to get out of the pickup unless a cow needs help, which is a plus on our cold and often windy February nights in western Nebraska. Very bright light and also lightweight and small. Would be a great light to have in a power failure. Very glad we purchased this, well worth the price, and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Prairie Girl

customer_reviews.title: it worked good. It got a little wet though
customer_reviews.text: While it worked, it worked good. It got a little wet though, not even soaked, and quit working. Then it wouldn't seem to hold a charge. I ended up replacing this unit with a different brand that is smaller, lighter, and waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Wired

customer_reviews.title: The "always on" switch is nice for comfort or if you need to set it ...
customer_reviews.text: We live on acreage and this spotlight has decent range. The "always on" switch is nice for comfort or if you need to set it down. Has two settings for high and low. I like the red cover so I can find my cat without destroying her night vision.
customer_reviews.author: Chemy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Also bought one as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Living on a farm, I go through these so this is the 4th one in 7 years. They all took abuse from being dropped and used nightly to lock in farm animals and watch for wildlife while letting the dogs out. Has a surprisingly long range and I can't do without one. Also comes with a car charger and I take with me quite often if I am gone after dark. Highly recommend. Also bought one as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Kuvasz

customer_reviews.title: Very bright compact spotlight.
customer_reviews.text: Small, Light and bright but the best feature of this light is the momentary contact trigger. I use this light for tractor trailer inspections in the early morining hours when it’s still dark. It lights up the entire undercarriage with one twitch of my index finger. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin R. Stiff, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Best Spotlight!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best spotlight I've found. I got it about 3-4 weeks ago and haven't charged it yet and it's still as bright as it was when I opened the package. I use it several times a night when taking my dogs out in the yard. The beam is super bright and you can see quite a distance. My yard is almost 10,000 square feet and I can see it all with no problem. I highly recommend this spotlight!
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is rechargeable and not on battery. Excellent brightness and not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Country Lady

customer_reviews.title: Battery dead in one year - Update
customer_reviews.text: The light is very bright and works well but after just over a year with minimal use the battery is dead and it won't take a charge. I called the manufacture and they will sell me another battery plus shipping for about 1/2 the cost of the original light. Update: My mistake I just learned that if you let this battery discharge all the way, even once you render it useless. I purposely did this before charging it thinking that I was doing the right thing. So I am buying a new battery for it. Don't let it discharge all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: only lasted 4 months! Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Lightly used for 4 months. Made a loud pop and started smoking. I would be afraid to keep this spotlight in the house now due to fire hazard. Called Cyclops customer and got no help because its one month out of warranty. don't buy this overpriced, Chinese made junk.
customer_reviews.author: carefulshopper

customer_reviews.title: Country Use
customer_reviews.text: We currently live on a 50 acre ranch in a foothill area of California. We have a large stretch of flatland and encounter local wild life quite often. This light works excellently when we are walking from structure to structure (house to the industrial garage) as well as into the fields and surrounding trees. 200 to 400 yards at a time. I could recommend this as far as someone living in a rural area, all natural lighting with dark and starry nights.
customer_reviews.author: BDo13

customer_reviews.title: I'm getting another one for the car.
customer_reviews.text: Bright as you will ever need unless your trying to signal a plane flying at 30,000 feet. Comes with both a car charger and AC adapter. I use it all the time when I take the dogs out at night so I can keep an eye on them. For emergencies this light will always be at the ready. Just keep it plugged in and it will be fully charged each time you use it. I'm have not tested the charge life on this thing yet but don't expect that it will be disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: ftorillo

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. Repeat purchaser.
customer_reviews.text: Hubby and dad needed these again after a few years. Purchased for Christmas because we were so impressed with them in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best spotlight he's ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Cyclops light that I have ordered for my husband over the last few years. Best light ever made for durability, amount of light and recharging capability. My husband has charged them hundreds of time and still gets a great spotlight for checking the fields on the farm at night. Tough, lightweight...
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence
customer_reviews.text: It's so have to find any product to surprise me in a good way anymore. BUT this light is super! the two settings work perfect for whatever your doing and it isn't very heavy at all. Easy to operate and handle. I charged it as instructed and have used it many times and it still shines bright from that first charge. Seems to be well made too.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Brown

customer_reviews.title: A Winner for Lightpainting!
customer_reviews.text: I use this light for lightpainting landscapes and it does a great job. I have used it for 3 consecutive 2-3 hour shoots without a recharge. Works well for painting up to 100-200 yards. Small, compact, powerful, and durable. Definitely a winner.
customer_reviews.author: TheExplorographer

customer_reviews.title: Good beam in the field.
customer_reviews.text: This light puts out a great beam in the field. I have purchased several for my family and the love them. Unable to find battery replacement however.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bickford

customer_reviews.title: Best flashlight ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best light ever! We live in the country and need a light like this. This is my second one since my first one got dropped a few too many times. I guess if you don't charge for a long time it may not work so keep it charged! Even with saying that I would still recommend it. It is the best flashlight I have ever owned and you can see so far with it.
customer_reviews.author: Laladyley

customer_reviews.title: May want to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: After looking at the reviews, I decided to order one. The first one came in and the battery would not take a charge. The unit was replaced immediately by Amazon. The second one didn't take a charge either. I didn't want to take a chance at another replacement. Tried to contact the manufacturer but never heard anything from them.
customer_reviews.author: Coachwhip

customer_reviews.title: Left in the dark. The light did not even work.
customer_reviews.text: Might have been a fluke, however, the item packaging seemed to be opened previously and the handle busted. On top of that, the light didn’t even work. The instructions state that it comes un-charged and to charge for 12 hours. I did so and not a flicker of light. I’m counting on it being a good light so hopefully I can get it returned and all this resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Savana

customer_reviews.title: Poor Performance
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product since August of 2013. I purchased it to use primarily for night photography: focusing in low light and light painting. I have been VERY disappointed in the product. Initially it was reasonably bright, but no longer holds a charge and even when fully charged the light is pretty dim.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Cagle

customer_reviews.title: we have cabin in the woods and this great for piercing into the night for wildlife or locating ...
customer_reviews.text: very strong bright light and holds its charge. we have cabin in the woods and this great for piercing into the night for wildlife or locating our dogs or signaling kids to come home for dinner.
customer_reviews.author: amzn shppr

customer_reviews.title: Convenient sized light
customer_reviews.text: Gives the option of a bright spot as well as a close-in option that functions like a large, standard flashlight. Just about the right size for keeping handy around the house; fits well in the hand. Holds a decent charge (so far) for about three weeks. The instructions tell you not to leave it plugged in, so be sure to plug in every 2-3 weeks - for a few hours - to maintain enough juice for use.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great Spotlight
customer_reviews.text: The Cyclops 500 Lumen is a great little Spotlight. I was really impressed with it's power. I compared it to a Spotlight that I've had for years, rated at 2 million Candle power. The Cyclops Spotlight is a lot smaller and liter than the old 2 mil. rated one yet, has a Brighter, Whiter light and a comparable Beam.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E Sibert

customer_reviews.title: Small, two beam intensities, and charges well. Check!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Stanley HIDLIS Lithium Ion Rechargeable Spotlight that could not hold a charge after about a month. Has been in use for almost a year. The small size and two intensity neam options are great. No use for the red cap. Bravo.
customer_reviews.author: ricracrum

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and brightness
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and brightness. I am a duck hunter and use this light going into the flooded timber prior to daybreak. Nice beam, light weight, durable, and long lasting. I have dropped it in the water several times. It floats and hasn't seemed to be affected. Very pleased and the cigarette lighter charger is a nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: My Cyclops 300 was great. This Cyclops 500 is disappointing..
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I previous;y purchased the Cyclop's Sirius 300 in 2013 and it lasted 4 years of abuse. Great light. I replaced it with this light a little over a year ago and it wont hold a a charge for more than 5 minutes. # stars at best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Charge
customer_reviews.text: Worked will once of twice, Now will not charge.. No red light... Nothing..
customer_reviews.author: Frank E Booth III

customer_reviews.title: great gift for h7bby
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this light for my husband. He coon hunts and needed a light that was long lasting, compact and light weight. He also wanted a red lens he could snap-on if he wanted. He is very happy! This light is exactly what he was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: splash

customer_reviews.title: My husband has enjoyed it. It reaches a long distances and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband has enjoyed it. It reaches a long distances and it's very bright
customer_reviews.author: Laura Esquivel

customer_reviews.title: Great like before
customer_reviews.text: Great like before. My second one of these. The previous one is still going strong. compared to the 700, which I have two, this is much better. The 700 still has battery issues. One light won't take charge anymore at all and the other lasts about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Anyone seen my mountain lion?
customer_reviews.text: This unit is very handy. I use it when I'm working in my horse barn which currently has no electrical. The red lens light up the eyes of critters starring at me from the forest - without washing out your own night vision. Some of them are not so friendly predators...so you have to be prepared. Long battery life and it really lights up an area. One o the best flashlights I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: great light
customer_reviews.text: great powerful light but the battery looses its most power in a short time, ive had 2 of these the 1st lasted 3 years, if I get 3 outta this one ill be happy :)
customer_reviews.author: dale boo

customer_reviews.title: A good light, but...
customer_reviews.text: I got this light back in November. It was a great light and worked fine, but now it will not charge. I am currently trying to contact the seller but can't find it on the page that I bought it from here in Amazon prime.
customer_reviews.author: whitedog

customer_reviews.title: perfect size spot light
customer_reviews.text: just recieved and its the perfect size for carrying in my hunting bag or in the glove box of the rhino and is it bright on spot. very long distance clear spot ,i shot a deer this year and could not find till next morning ,and it was 50 yards for where it was hit in the woods and i could not find with a flash light , problem solved with this little spot light with extra long range
customer_reviews.author: bg

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 of these light and I can't say ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these light and I can't say enough about the brightness of them. only negative is the battery life. If you keep them charge they should last longer. The battery is replaceable from Batteries Plus. Otherwise I would give it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Terry Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Durable Bright Light
customer_reviews.text: Great spotlight! Use on our 12 acres. Love the feel of the grip and powerful illumination. Brighter and covers more distance than our Stanley that quit working after about a year. Holds charge. Knocked this one off kitchen counter onto concrete floor. No damage and perfect working order.
customer_reviews.author: Sand Dollar

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  Stadium Lighting
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for an old school 3 D cell MagLite with a Krypton bulb. I ordered this Cyclops unit based on reviews and the LED technology. As I said above, WOW! this throws some serious light and weighs half as much as the MagLite. Love it! I'll be ordering another one to keep in the car for emergency use.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Bought it maybe 7 months ago and stuck it in ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it maybe 7 months ago and stuck it in a drawer charged and never used it. Took it out and charged it fully and the power is maybe 30% of what it was when new. The spotlight feature which shined across the river now only lights my deck. Guess the battery is just junk. No shelf life on this product.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great strong bright light
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift and they love it, to walk the dog, take camping and even finding lost things in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Husband uses for work and LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a UPS driver, and has problems finding addresses after the sun goes down, because a lot of people don't illuminate their house numbers. We bought this for him and he said it's the best purchase he's ever made. It has a straight beam of light he can quickly use to find house numbers without lighting up the whole house, and it reaches extremely far. It's super easy to charge and holds a charge a long time. Great buy if you need to see far at night!
customer_reviews.author: Geneva R.

customer_reviews.title: Average light.
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting a little more. Not a bad light, just average.
customer_reviews.author: Bellejeep

customer_reviews.title: Cyclops Sirius 500 Lumen Handheld Spotlight
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest spotlight. So well made and it really shines far and lights up really great what I am looking at. I also like that it has a dimmer light for general walking around. It is lightweight and easy to carry around. I also liked the red lens attachment that came with it. I for sure would buy one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Thing

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and falsely advertised
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months, it no longer would shine bright or for a long distance. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This light delivered more than I expected in quality and usefulness. Being out in the country we need use it regularly each evening after the sun goes down. Plenty bright and has held up to nightly use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: when we bought this is was for the boat. Looked at several in the "stores" and decided that after reading the reviews and information that this one would be good. The comfort of the grip is better than any, the light is just what it says, we can see our channel markers when needed using this. We even had the Cyclops in the house the other night and heard a loud noise outside and spotted a fox running with a mouse in his mouth, we could see it clearly with all the light. Hold the charge well also compared to others on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Good light
customer_reviews.text: Works great, really bright. Charge lasts several hours on full beam
customer_reviews.author: KPO2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent power
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this spot light. Plenty of power, 2 settings. Lightweight and hold a charge for weeks. Charges over night. UPDATE, 4 years later and I (finally) had to replace the battery. I'm not complaining, I'm actually still very impressed with this spotlight.
customer_reviews.author: Steele

customer_reviews.title: Company required "to" shipping costs to replace brand new unit
customer_reviews.text: I received the spotlight and began to charge it per the instructions. Within an hour the spotlight battery area was warm and there was a smell of burning electronics, so I unplugged and called the manufacturer (Amazon won't accept the light back due to its batteries). The manufacturer stated that it wasn't normal to have the odor, and was willing to replace the unit if I paid to have it shipped back to them first. It will cost at least $10 to ship it back. Considering this is a brand new unit and it is clearly malfunctioning, their response was not satisfactory. Someone else reviewed it for a similar odor. Perhaps they had the same issues?
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boat Spot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spotlight to use on my pontoon. There were many boats on the river (4th of July). This powerful spot was indisensible in lighting the bridges, keeping a safe distance from others, and guiding back into our slip at the marina. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the best spotlight lantern I have ever owned and I've had quite a few. Very light weight, small size, great distance illumination. Lasts a very, very long time on one charge. Had it for almost a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Eberhart

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Cordless Spotlight
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cyclops. The effective distance is only about 65 yards but its easy to carry and handle. The quality of construction is very good. Battery life is good. Only con is that they changed the charging connection from the old Cyclops so I have to bring along both chargers. It's a good quality light that does what I expected it to do. I'll probably buy another someday.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Love my new spotlight!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rechargeable spotlight with low high beam. I can see for miles when needed. Holds a charge well and I use it almost nightly. So glad I decided to purchase it!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Very light to carry and nice bright beam
customer_reviews.text: It does seem to require charging after about 5 or so hours. I use it when walking my dog and so take it for about 45 minutes each day. I can see the deer, armadillos, and other critters he is barking at as we walk.
customer_reviews.author: Lake lady

customer_reviews.title: Bright light with long distance range
customer_reviews.text: Bright light that recharges with a wall charger. Battery in this holds for a month or two depending on frequency of use. I use this for ten to twenty minutes every other day or so. Last time I bought this the battery completely died after a year, so I'm hoping this one lasts.
customer_reviews.author: jo al

customer_reviews.title: I can see again
customer_reviews.text: now I have two fantastic lights to find my way in duck boat. One for home to see my dogs when let out at night. Great light
customer_reviews.author: Wandasue

customer_reviews.title: BEST battery-powered spotlight/flashlight I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: BEST battery-powered spotlight/flashlight I've ever purchased! Battery lasts a long time off charger, and the spotlight is strong - I can see all over our 3 acres.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn H.

product_meta.title: Cyclops HAND HELD RECHARGEABLE LIGHTS CYC-X500H Flashlight
product_meta.description: Outdoorsmen love the convenient and adaptable design of the Cyclops Sirius battery operated LED handheld spotlight - 500 lumen when you're away from a power source. Ideal for both long and short range, the ergonomic rubberized grip with trigger pulse switch provides comfort. Includes an always-on lock switch, 6V battery, Red lens, home, and car charger.
